name: Chiangmai Hill 2000 Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night end of October. It is quite an old property but it wasn't too bad for me when you consider the cheap room rate. Location is near the trendy spots of Nimmanhemin but nothing much right by the vicinity of the hotell. Our room faced the hills and it was quite pretty. I also liked that the window could be opened.
reviews.title: Cheap Hotel in Chiang Mai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only nasty surprise was when we asked for ice. A big bucket was brought up and we discovered that it costs THB71! I have never had to pay for ice ever throughout my numerous hotel stays! I wouldn't have minded so much if they informed me upon ordering.
reviews.title: This was one of our better hotels on the group tour

reviews.text: Overall, for the price we paid it was really good value. Many tuk2 and taxis run pass the hotel. However, it was too far from the ciy center if you plan to visit the night bazaar and markets. We were there for only 1 night as a transit between Pai and Bangkok. Thus, it was OK for us.
reviews.title: OK to stay, but no atmosphere

reviews.text: This is a great hotel, equal to a Hilton in the US. That is rare in Thailand, but this hotel staff knows Western standards. The breakfast was excellent (with the exception of those nasty British banger sausages lol.) We had eggs fixed many ways, bacon, potatoes, etc. If I am ever in the area again I would request the Chiangmai Hill as my hotel of choice.
reviews.title: Good value

description: Fomerly the Chiang Mai Hills Hotel.
